name: Coast Plaza Hotel & Suites

reviews.text: Loved looking at the mountains from the northern balcony on the 25th floor. Spotless room, good coffee, good soap, etc. But it's the hotel staff who are so helpful.... from the reservation desk to the woman who cleaned my room...nothing but friendly, smiling service and information which makes you feel right at home in a strange place. And then there's that massive pool in the basement (P2 on the elevator!)
reviews.title: A North -facing Room

reviews.text: My 2nd visit to this hotel and this time i was on the 22nd floor - stunning views of English Bay!!
reviews.title: Good views

reviews.text: Rooms are a average but clean
reviews.title: Worth the extra walk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good link to the supermarket and shops below
reviews.title: Great!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only 5 mins walk to English Bay and Stanley Park
reviews.title: Great location but really in need of renovations

reviews.text: We chose this hotel for romantic getaway for our 15 wedding anniversary.
reviews.title: Enjoyed getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel with rooms stylished by 80s - we like that style. Very helpful staff, pleasant atmosphere. Stanley Park, all amenities nearby. View from our room on 33rd floor was stunning. Having a balcony to walk out and enjoy North Shore and Lions Gate Bridge was great. Very comfortable bed. Overall very satisfied.
reviews.title: Nice Place to Stay

reviews.text: This hotel is very convenient for those of us that love the waterfront of English Bay and the trails in Stanley Park. It is also great because you can get a full kitchen and make your own meals (grocery store in the lower level of the same building).
reviews.title: My favorite Vancouver hotel.

reviews.text: There are also all kinds of restaurants within walking distance and Robson St. shopping not far away either.
reviews.title: Mediocrity with a View

reviews.text: Great location in the West End of Vancouver. Great views of city or English Bay from upper floors. Hotel is over shopping mall that has pharmacy, grocery, etc. Lot's of internationl restaurants on Denman Street. Lynn who works in the hotel restaurant has been there waiting on me for over 20 years! How many hotels keep wonderful staff that long! Food is consistantly good and recent updates on the decor have brought things up to date. Last Saturday I stayed on the 33rd floor and it couldn't have been better. Suite had kitchen with comfortable living room and separate bedroom with new comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Good location, beautiful views

reviews.text: Stayed at the Coast for a conference and got the conference rate - $188/night for a "premium" room (they had no "standard" rooms left). I can't imagine what the regular rate is, but $188 + tax got two of us a two bed, one bedroom suite with older decor, a small full kitchen and a "Bathfitter" style bathroom (colleagues who booked a couple of days earlier got a similar room for $158 + tax). A small balcony opens off the main "living room." Overall impression of the room was that it was tired and in need of a renovation/makeover. Didn't need all of the extras - would have been happy with a simpler room but this was all the had left.
reviews.title: You're Paying for Location, that's about it

reviews.text: Parking is an extra $20/night unless you're lucky enough to score one of the half-dozen or so parking meter spots in front of the hotel (free parking on the street between 10 pm and 9 am).
reviews.title: Worth a second chance

reviews.text: Beds were fairly comfortable but the sheets were starchy and scratchy. Sleep was next to impossible - not due to the noise of other tenants but due to the noise of the elevator. I couldn't figure out what it was at first and thought it might have been someone running a bath or moving furniture. Elevator sounds like a wounded animal moaning underwater.
reviews.title: Good base for Vancouver

reviews.text: The only plus side for this hotel was the location - easy walking to restaurants and bars and Stanley Park. As we got in late and had to leave early, we didn't have a chance to enjoy this aspect of our stay.
reviews.title: Old and tacky

reviews.text: Stayed here a couple of weeks ago and based on my room (on the 16th floor) I would have given it 2 stars and said it was awful - my room was totally outdated and my fridge made noises all night that woke me up.
reviews.title: Great location and views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't be discouraged by the somewhat drab exterior. Although a little dated, this place has good sized rooms and apartments, friendly staff and is good value for money. Staying there was such a relief after travelling throughout Canada in small hotel rooms for 4 weeks. The added bonus is it's right in the heart of the West End precinct, and close to public transport and all the tourist sites. We stayed there twice in different rooms, either side of an Alaskan cruise. Both rooms had balconies with fantastic views and were well appointed, with comfortable beds. We really appreciated the guest laundry as we had been on the road for so long. There is a good bar and restaurant onsite, which was very convenient if you don't feel like going too far, although there are many local choices of good restaurants along Denman street. There is also a gym ( but we didn't use it), and handy shopping centre underneath where you can get any supplies you need. Taxi rank is right outside.
reviews.title: Perfect base in Vancouver

reviews.text: The view from our 28th floor suite was spectacular.We could see English Bay,Stanley Park,and The Lions Gate Bridge.It was a short walk to the beach or Stanley Park.Our suite was roomy and had everthing we needed for our stay.The kitchen had all the appliances and utensils you need to buy some groceries and have a few quick meals.Service was excellent and there was plenty of underground parking.
reviews.title: what a view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is over 40 years old and this is reflected in its design and layout. However, although a little out of the centre of Vancouver, it is a clean and comfortable hotel with good sized rooms. There were good views over the city from our 24th floor room.
reviews.title: Canada Trip

reviews.text: The staff were friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was quite good and although there was not a huge menu the meals we had were of a good size, well cooked and hot.
reviews.title: A view of the ocean

reviews.text: I was on the 22nd floor and had wonderful views of the beach and ocean of English Bay. I have stayed at this Hotel in the September of the last seven years. I always find it clean ,good service and a very helpful staff
reviews.title: Had a great stay!

description: Contemporary 35-story Hotel located downtown, near Stanley Park & English Bay.
